Representatives from the three African nations on the UN Security Council -- Kenya, Ghana, and Gabon -- all condemned reports of discrimination against African citizens at the Ukrainian border during a meeting at the UN HQ in New York City Monday.

There have been widespread reports from African students fleeing the country that they faced segregation, racism and abuse. 

"In the unfolding emergency, there have been disturbing reports about the racist treatment of Africans and people of African descent seeking to flee Ukraine to safety. The media is covering these appalling incidents and several states have confirmed that their citizens are suffering such treatment. We strongly condemn this racism and believe that it is damaging to the spirit of solidarity that is so urgently needed today. 

"The mistreatment of African peoples on Europe's borders needs to cease immediately, whether to the Africans fleeing Ukraine or to those crossing the Mediterranean," Kenyan Ambassador to the UN Martin Kimani said Monday.

heading: Djokovic 'playing by his own rules', says Tsitsipas
body: World number one Novak Djokovic has been "playing by his own rules" and has put his bid for a 21st Grand Slam title at risk by not following Australia's COVID-19 vaccination requirements, world number four Stefanos Tsitsipas said on Thursday.

heading: Meet Maserati's new SUV Grecale
body: Maserati unveiled its new SUV Grecale only the second SUV in the Italian luxury brand's history. An all-electric version, releasing next year, will be the company's first EV SUV.

heading: From love to loss: See the conflict in Ukraine through a wedding photographer's lens
body: Professional photographer and Kharkiv local Pavel Dorogoy used to shoot weddings. Now he shoots war, documenting the devastation of his hometown during the Russian invasion.

heading: Truck tossed on its side in reported tornado
body: Brian Emfinger captured this video of a truck getting blown over and tossed around in high winds from a reported tornado near Elgin, Texas. The driver was able to drive away.

heading: Here's why Russian forces have problems with command and control
body: CNN reporter Katie Bo Lillis and retired Major General James Marks break down Russian troops' problems with command and control as they are facing three separate fights in Ukraine.

heading: See explosion and gunfire in Kherson amid peaceful protest
body: Video shows an explosion and gunfire during what appears to be a peaceful protest in Kherson, Ukraine. At least one person has been reported injured in the incident.

heading: Bringing back wolves to a Portuguese valley
body: Pedro Prata is working to rewild the Coa Valley in Portugal, bringing back wild horses as a first step on the journey to returning wolves and lynx.

heading: Pro-Putin tabloid scrubs Russian invasion casualty figure
body: Komsomolskaya Pravda, a pro-Putin Russian tabloid, reported nearly 10,000 Russian soldiers have died fighting in Ukraine before quickly scrubbing the figure from its website. CNN's Nada Bashir reports.

heading: People struggling to survive in key Ukrainian port city
body: CNN's Phil Black has the latest on what life is like in Mariupol, one of Ukraine's heavily shelled and bombed cities and a key target for the Russian forces.

heading: How Alexey Navalny became the face of opposition in Putin's Russia (2021)
body: Anti-corruption activist, Kremlin critic and politician: Here's what you need to know about Alexey Navalny, one of the most prominent faces of opposition in Vladimir Putin's Russia.

heading: Video shows what happened to China Eastern airliner that crashed
body: A China Eastern Airliner jet crashed in the mountains of southern China according to China's Civil Aviation Administration. All 132 passengers were killed. CNN's Pete Muntean reports.

heading: Video shows Navalny on the phone with Russian spy (2020)
body: CNN has obtained audio and video of Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny speaking to one of the Russian agents sent to tail him around the country, who reveals details of  Navalny's poisoning in August. CNN's Clarissa Ward reports.

heading: Take a ride on London's new $25bn tube line
body: Named after Queen Elizabeth II, Crossrail is set to partially open in 2022 as the Elizabeth line. It will connect East and West London like never before.

heading: Strong tornadoes, large hail, and strong winds likely for parts of the South
body: Strong tornadoes, large hail, and damaging winds are likely for parts of much of Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama. Parts of Texas, Florida, and Tennessee can be impacted as well. CNN meteorologist Pedram Javaheri has the forecast.

heading: 'Drive My Car' director on his 'unexpected' Best Picture nomination
body: Ryusuke Hamaguchi's "Drive My Car" has received four Oscar nominations, including Best Director and Japan's first in the Best Picture category. The director discusses what it means for him and the global filmmaking industry.

heading: Ex-football player makes emotional appearance on NBC's 'Today'
body: After announcing his retirement from football, Buckeyes player Harry Miller shares his struggles with depression and anxiety.

heading: Doorbell camera shows bounce house fly through the air
body: A North Carolina family is urging others to keep up with the weather forecast after a huge gust of wind sent a bounce house in their yard flying, narrowly missing their 5-year-old child. CNN affiliate WSOC has more.

heading: 'Impossible to intercept': This is Russia's new deadly weapon
body: US officials confirm that Russia is the first country to use hypersonic missiles ever in combat. CNN's Brian Todd tells us what this means for Ukraine.

heading: 'Breaks my heart': Actress reacts to famous dad's remarks at pro-war rally
body: Russian actress Masha Mashkova is speaking out against Russia's war in Ukraine after her father, Russian actor Vladimir Mashkov, spoke at Vladimir Putin's rally in support of the war.

heading: 'You're dealing with the wrong dude!': Republican candidates get heated at debate
body: Josh Mandel and Mike Gibbons, both Republican candidates for Ohio's US Senate seat, had to be separated after a heated exchange during a primary debate.

heading: This explains why some African countries have been more muted toward Putin
body: Despite denouncing Russian President Vladimir Putin's decision to invade Ukraine, several African countries are opting for a "more muted" response towards the conflict.

heading: CNN10: The big stories of the day, explained in 10 minutes
body: Another step is taken in the U.S. Supreme Court confirmation process, wildfires scorch thousands of acres in Texas, and global aid pours into Ukraine.

heading: Girl who sang 'Let It Go' from bomb shelter sings Ukrainian national anthem for thousands
body: Seven-year-old Amelia Anisovych, whose video singing the song "Let It Go" from a Ukrainian bomb shelter made rounds on the internet, recently performed the Ukrainian national anthem for thousands in Poland.

heading: Former NATO adviser: Putin won't stop unless he's stopped in Ukraine
body: With fighting in Ukraine at a bloody stalemate, defense expert Evelyn Farkas worries that the war will go on as long as both sides think they can win.

heading: 'Never, ever will Mariupol surrender': Top Zelensky Adviser
body: Igor Zhovkva, chief diplomatic adviser to Ukraine's President Zelensky, tells Christiane Amanpour that Russia is fighting against children and women in the city of Mariupol.

heading: Why a rock star traded his guitar for a gun in fight against Russia
body: Musician Sergiy Fomenko once played his guitar and serenaded protestors seeking to drive out a pro-Russia government in Ukraine. Now the singer has traded his guitar for a gun in his country's fight against the Russian military. CNN's Sam Kiley reports.

heading: CNN's Sam Kiley meets a popular musician who traded his music for a job in a volunteer battalion defending Ukraine
body: CNN's Sam Kiley reports.

heading: 'We must do better:' Experts analyze Western media bias in Ukraine coverage
body: Media coverage of the war in Ukraine has largely been praised. Some journalists see this as an opportunity to reevaluate how wars and conflicts are covered when the victims are not mainly White or directly related to Western interests.

heading: 'The last couple weeks were like hell': Evacuees describe terror of Russian attacks
body: CNN's Ivan Watson speaks with one family who evacuated Mariupol, Ukraine, as Russian forces bombed the city.

heading: See Supreme Court nominee Ketanji Brown Jackson's opening statement
body: Supreme Court nominee Ketanji Brown Jackson addresses a divided Senate as the first day of her nomination confirmation hearing begins. If confirmed, Jackson would become the first Black woman justice.
